description: A headless consent engine that transforms privacy management from a compliance checkbox into a fully observable system. Built for modern development teams with GDPR compliance, TypeScript-first APIs, and framework-agnostic design.
rules: Package selection: Use @c15t/react for React apps, @c15t/nextjs for Next.js (App Router & Pages Router), or c15t for vanilla JavaScript
Use @c15t/cli generate for the easiest setup - it installs packages, configures your instance, sets up environment variables, and adds components automatically
Configuration modes: Use mode: 'c15t' with backendURL for hosted/managed consent.io instances (recommended), mode: 'offline' for client-side only with localStorage, or custom client for full control
For production, use consent.io (hosted) or self-hosted @c15t/backend. Offline mode is only for development or simple implementations
Consent categories: Use 'necessary' (always required), 'measurement' (analytics like GA4), 'marketing' (advertising like Google Ads, Meta Pixel), and 'functional' (optional features)
Always check consent before loading analytics/tracking scripts using the has() method: has('measurement') for analytics, has('marketing') for advertising
Use the script loader for conditional script loading: add scripts array to ConsentManagerProvider options with category property matching consent categories
For tag managers (GTM, PostHog) that handle consent internally, use alwaysLoad: true - these scripts load immediately and manage their own consent state
React/Next.js: Wrap your app with ConsentManagerProvider, include CookieBanner and ConsentManagerDialog components. In Next.js App Router, use 'use client' directive
Next.js: Use Next.js Rewrites to proxy backendURL through /api/c15t/:path* to hide the backend URL from users

Consent checking: Use has() with simple checks (has('marketing')), complex logic (has({ and: ['measurement', 'marketing'] })), or nested conditions (has({ and: ['necessary', { or: ['measurement', 'marketing'] }] }))
Prebuilt scripts available in @c15t/scripts: googleTagManager, googleTag (GA4 + Google Ads with Consent Mode v2), metaPixel, posthog, tiktokPixel, linkedinInsights, microsoftUet, xPixel
Google Tag (gtag.js): Use category: 'measurement' for GA4 analytics-only, category: 'marketing' for Google Ads. c15t automatically configures Consent Mode v2 defaults
Geo-location: Set ignoreGeoLocation: true during development to always show the banner. In production, GDPR banners show automatically for EU users
Server-side rendering: Consent state is stored in cookies accessible both client and server-side. Use server-side consent checks in Next.js middleware and API routes
Translations: Import from @c15t/translations package. Supports partial or complete translations with type-safe interfaces
TypeScript-first: All APIs are fully typed. Use TypeScript for best experience with autocomplete and type safety
Performance: c15t is lightweight with minimal bundle impact. Scripts load/unload dynamically based on consent changes
Privacy by design: GDPR-compliant by default with granular consent controls and complete audit trail for compliance
